reference.shortdesc: The repsep element identifies a character used in a syntax diagram to indicate that a group of syntax elements can (or should) be repeated.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: If the repsep element contains a separator character such as a plus (+), this indicates that the character must be used between repetitions of the syntax elements.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The repsep element is specialized from ph. It is defined in the syntax diagram domain module, which is a specialization of the programming domain module.

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following code sample example, a file listing can be requested for multiple volumes. The repsep element identifies that each requested volume can be separated with a comma.
